item.title: Luna Moth extortion hackers pose as IT help desks to breach US firms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The data-theft extortion group known as Luna Moth, aka Silent Ransom Group, has ramped up callback phishing campaigns in attacks on legal and financial institutions in the United States. [...]

item.title: New "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass used in ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass technique is exploited in attacks to bypass SentinelOne's tamper protection feature, allowing threat actors to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) agents to install the Babuk ransomware. [...]

item.title: Microsoft finds default Kubernetes Helm charts can expose data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft warns about the security risks posed by default configurations in Kubernetes deployments, particularly those using out-of-the-box Helm charts, which could publicly expose sensitive data. [...]

item.title: Unofficial Signal app used by Trump officials investigates hack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: TeleMessage, an Israeli company that sells an unofficial Signal message archiving tool used by some U.S. government officials, has suspended all services after reportedly being hacked. [...]

item.title: Darcula PhaaS steals 884,000 credit cards via phishing texts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Darcula phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform stole 884,000 credit cards from 13 million clicks on malicious links sent via text messages to targets worldwide. [...]

item.title: Microsoft is killing Skype today, pushes users to Teams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Skype video call and messaging service is shutting down today, 14 years after replacing Microsoft's Windows Live Messenger. [...]

item.title: UK shares security tips after major retail cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Following three high-profile cyberattacks impacting major UK retailers, the country's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has published guidance that all companies are advised to follow to strengthen their cybersecurity defenses. [...]

item.title: Microsoft silently fixes Start menu bug affecting Windows 10 PCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has silently fixed an issue that broke Start Menu jump lists for all apps on systems running Windows 10, version 22H2. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows 11 24H2 now ready to rollout to everyone
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft announced over the weekend that the Windows 11 24H2 update is ready to roll out to all compatible PCs, excluding those with safeguard holds. [...]

item.title: OpenAI document explains when to use each ChatGPT model
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI admitted that it can be confusing for users to choose between all the different models, but the company has quietly published a document that makes it easier to understand ChatGPT. [...]

item.title: StealC malware enhanced with stealth upgrades and data theft tools
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The creators of StealC, a widely-used information stealer and malware downloader, have released its second major version, bringing multiple stealth and data theft enhancements. [...]

item.title: Google NotebookLM is now using Gemini 2.5 Flash
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google NotebookLM, which is a research and note-taking AI tool, is getting upgraded to Gemini 2.5 Flash. [...]

item.title: Microsoft ends Authenticator password autofill, moves users to Edge
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has announced that it will discontinue the password storage and autofill feature in the Authenticator app starting in July and will complete the deprecation in August 2025. [...]
